text: Pours cloudy and lots of frothy head. Nose is yeast and cereal. Flavours are yeast and cereal, some citrus. Taste med sweet light bitter. Full creamy body lively carbonation.

Very clear orange with a big white head. Dull floral hop aroma. Smooth a bit sweet. Some plum and raisin 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bouteille de 750ml. Arôme imperceptible. Col qui ne perdure pas. Goût astringent très agressif. Correcte.
"this has a nice crisp feel to it, and a pleasant fruity aroma...pear, hops and yeast, and a flavor to match. this was a refreshing, but tasty and complex golden ale."
Pours golden. Aroma of a kolsch. Tastes like a kolsch: an average kolsch. Refreshing, but not particularly flavourful.

Bottle, 11.5 oz, screw-top. Nose is strongly sweet and fruity with a candyish edge and bits of what reminds me of spaghetti sauce (that I now assume to be from a certain hop). Very pale yellow, only a few shades darker than clear, with a distinct pink tinge on the edges; fizzy and enormous, explosive white head (so tread carefully) from overabundant carbonation. Taste is lightly tart, lightly bitter, very sugary (leaves sugar on the teeth!), with black pepper and some esters, and a little alcohol heat. Sharp but faint caramel, lots of fruit, lightly chalky with vanilla, fullish (too full) body. Something of a cloying mess but at least it goes for Belgian Strong or Saison instead of bland blonde.
Très sucrée en effet. Une mousse imide et un corps un peu flat. Je suis peut-être tombé sur une mauvaise bouteilles. Ça se boit bien, mais cest prèsque plus un jus quune bière. Décevant.
Orange, pine, candy. Lemon zest, floral hops, tart. A well crafted and enjoyable golden ale.

Very sweet. The aroma is honey, light plastic, like a cough drop. The appearance is very hazy yellow, white head. The flavor is very sweet, honey, bubble gum. The finish is the most sweet, bubble gum, honey, light pine. Medium in body. Pretty unique, nice overall.

Ya quelque chose de très noble avec cette rafraîchissante blonde bue directement au pub. Des notes herbacés, citronnés et céréalière simposent délicatement dans un équilibre impressionnant. Buvabilité imposante.

On tap at Station Ho.st. Pours a My wife said this smells like new CDs. The smell of a fresh spindle. I got sort of a dusty musky paper note from it. Medium-bodied, slightly sweet, a bit of crackery grain, warm toast, musky yeast. Very nice, super easy drinking.
12oz bottle-trade with jtclockwork-big white-hazy pale yellow. A-lt malt, citrus-lemon, apple skin. T-spice/citrus hops, lt malt.
On draft at brewery, listed as a kolsch. a bit to sweet and malty without the crisp bite I expect from a kolsch, oh eell

Not exactly a typical blonde beer. Pours golden with ok lacing, some head. Some interesting helles-like aroma in malt. Finishes with light sweet malt. Average carbonation. Very grainy. Tap at new brewpub.

Pour is a cloudy blonde with a huge white head. Aroma is some lagerish bready malts with a noble hop. Flavor is somewhat fruity but also a bit grassy hop bitterness. The malt is bone dry but adds a little honey after the swallow. This is a good beer with some lager notes along with a nice ale yeast. Not 90 percentile good but better than the average blonde ale.

750ml bottle. Hazy and unfiltered pale golden yellow with a generous slightly off white head that lasts throughout. Slight farmhouse, but of grass, yeast, wheat, bit of lemon zest but muted, dr, slightly sweet, moderate carbonation and a light body, refreshing, clean finish. Tasty.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2013 Bottle from State Line. Pours cloudy gold with big fluffy white head. Nose and taste of freshly baked bread, fresh sugared cereal, citrus, pear, pie crust, yeast and spicy grassy hops. Soft carbonation. Medium body. Really nice balance. The best beer Ive ever had in this style by far. I usually hate this style, but I wanted more of this. In fact, I might drive 3 hours just to get another bottle. Its just that good.

750 ml bottle. Pours a mostly clear straw with some sediments, resilient white head sits on top. Flavor is pils malt, wheat. Finish is very herbal hops, some spices, too. Lingering herbal feel. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Felt very generic to me. I guess I dont get the hype.

Rares sont les blondes qui réussissent à attirer lattention (pour les bonnes raisons du moins) ; avec son bouquet houblonné, céréalier et fruité, ses notes de sucre et damertume bien dosées, lOstalgia devient lune des seules blondes québécoises à nous rappeler quune bonne blonde, ça existe. Limpide, belle mousse blanche sur un liquide bien doré, elle nest pas exempte de défauts (un tout petit côté médicamenteux, effervescence timide comme tous les autres produits Hopfenstark), mais vaut définitivement le détour.
On tap at Pizzeria Paradiso.  Pale blonde. Dry and a bit bitter. Mild pear and peach in the background. Faint floral notes & dry spice. Nose a bit weak. Otherwise great.
Bouteille de 341ml, robe blonde limpide, arôme de malt , goût de levure (banane) très florale.

On tap at Vice-Versa in Montreal. Aroma: Citrus with orange zest and a touch of cereal. Nose could stick out more. Appearance: Traditional gold blond with small head sticking to glass with nice lacing. Taste: Attack with spicy notes with citrus and orange coming back. Texture is between light and average. This beer is OK but under my expectations for this reputed brewery.

12 oz. bottle, pours a cloudy blonde with a humungous frothy white head with good lacing. Aroma is very wheaty, with loads of freshly baked bread, some dough, cereal, and  hay - very fresh nose. Flavour is fruity, something the nose didnt give off, with notes of banana, lemon and green apples, which is then overtaken by the prominent notes of hay, freshly baked bread and loads of cereal malt. Rather flavourful for being a 5% blond, a style that is usually bland and generic. Dry and soft mouthfeel, with a wonderful amount of fruitiness that makes this very refreshing. Most excellent thirst quencher with lots of depth and complexity. Surprisingly awesome.
On tap at Vices et versa (Montreal). Pours clear golden with thin white head. Not much on the aroma but taste is great: caramel, malt and fruits. Medium bodied. Interesting.

Bottle (brand new bottle to our market, date code seems to indicated 01/12). Pours with a lightly hazed, very pale, straw yellow hued body with a large and lasting white head. Aromas are quite estery with some acetaldehyde and straw. Lots of apple, baked bread, pear, grassy hop. Bready and toasty malt. Cidery. Flavors are malty and bready, medium sulfur and cleaner than the nose. Medium assertive bitterness with a lightly grassy hop character. Toasted and bready malt flavors compete. Carbonation is high ( what seems like above 2.8 volumes of CO2).  Medium estery, lightly cidery, some alcohol. I was looking forward to this, but I am pretty disappointed. Medium-thin body. Dry.

IP trade in Montreal for this bottle - thanks to Patrick, drank in Apr 12.

Poured from a 341 ml bottle into a tulip glass to a slightly hazed golden colour with a medium white head.

A grassy nose with yeast notes, citrus, malt an spice coming across.

Taste wise bready malts, a lemony hop bitterness, honey and a yeast flavour similar to that found in a saison.

Medium body and carbonation with a clean finish.

Overall and enjoyable beer crisp and refreshing, almost helles meets saison !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Sampled in a 11.5 oz bottle. Pours light yellow and a huge head. A nice Belgian blonde but not the best i have had. A nice summer brew.
Bottle. Pours a light yellow color with white head. Very foamy. Hay, skunky, malty aroma and flavor. Ok

Bottle. Golden-straw beer with an off-white head. Yeast and light fruity aroma with breadiness. Yeast and spice flavor with malt and citrus. Medium bodied. Yeast and spice lingers with citrus and malt.

Tasted yesterday in honor of Canada Day, cheers!  Cloudy golden color, massive white ice cream cone head, solid lacing. Aroma of duty, earthy lemons and straw. Taste is barnyard, rising bread dough, sour citrus. Very nice.

Draft. Hazy blonde pour, good lace/retention. Aroma of straw, cracker, bread, grass, yeast, lightly tart. Taste is quite dry, light grassy hops, cracker, earth. Palate is soft, creamy, lightly bitter finish. Very good.

Bottle: pours cloudy yellow golden, milky white head. Nose is coriander, biscuit malts, subtle earth notes. More of the same once on the palate. Subtle coriander, yeast, milk thistle  with a milky consistency. Quite drinkable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dun jaune pâle qui contient une multitude de sédiments en suspens ayant une mousse timide. Des odeurs légèrement fruitées et houblonnées réussissent tant bien que mal à se signaler. Un goût surette, légèrement acidulé, laissant passer ici et là des pointes de miel et du blé. Elle est relativement bien équilibrée. Je ny trouve pas de grandes qualités ni de gros défauts. En vérifiant la date dembouteillage, je constate quelle est vieille de 5 mois. Peut-être que plus fraîche je lapprécierais plus? (231-120512)

Small bottle from  Sams.  Hazy yellow golden with a thick meringue like head.  Nose is grassy, earthy, very clean, light plastic,  lightly herbal.   Flavor is a little more complex, very lightly spiced, some light funk more grass and earthy notes, cantaloupe, peach.  Finish is a little plasticy, with some clean bitterness.  Some imperfections, but overall very good.

"333" from The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours rather dishwater gold with a white head. Aroma of mild - both bread and probably saaz. Med body. Flavor is something of a fruity pils. Not strongly fruity - but its there. Lightly bready and rather herbal hop. Its bitter enough to push into a decent pils range, but this is an ale. Perhaps this is what happens with pils ingredients and an ale yeast. Might account for the fruit hint. Main attraction is the bitter finish - also it could pass for a clean beer. Sadly.

12 ounce bottle from The Davis Beer Shoppe.  $6...yikes!  The aroma on this is very nice with some subtle biscuit and doughy malts present.  A light honey aroma is also present.  Hazy, cloudy, unfiltered straw-colored body with a medium, strong fluffy white head present.  Good lacing.  Blondes should be filtered, no?  Starts with a, earthy hop bitterness, which is fairly aggressive.  This is followed by some light, cereal maltiness, which tastes a lot like pilsner malt.  Finishes crisp, dry, and even more earthy with a significant hop kick. There is a very nice, creamy, perfect carbonated body on this.  An enjoyable beer for summer, but at 50 cents an ounce, I cant really justify buying this beer again.  I have a feeling this beer will sit on the shelves for awhile, and that stale product will not be a good thing...especially with a hoppy beer like this.  My bottle was bottled in 01/2012

Bottle from Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours cloudy golden with a fluffy white head and a standard pils aroma. There is a rich carbonated pilsner malt flavor with a floral hop flavor and a mildly bitter dry finish.

Giant white head, lively hazy golden nice lacing merigue like... Fairly hoppy aroma, pale lively sweet malt grass citrus... kind of fruity biscuity bready notes, belg yeast fruitiness??? lively medium to medium thin toasty body...
12 oz bottle. Lots of head, pale gold, floral aroma, sweet taste.  Very good blonde.
Bottle thanks to SlovakSniper - pours a hazy golden with a really nice  champagne head. Smells very sweet with citrus - lemon and grapefruit. Taste of grapefruit, spice, honey. Pretty good!

Bottle 341ml
Pours hazy blond with good white head, fully lasting. Aroma is of strong citrus (grapefruits) and spices. Tastes grapefruit, hops, some honey. Good, but not outstanding. Refreshing.

Bottle 341 ml [2012]. Appereance: Pour hazy golden with some sediments and a nice white rocky foam. Aroma: Fruity esters (citrus, grapefruit, banana ?). Taste: Grapefruits, honey and flower/herbal. Overall: Very refreshing. Nice blond ale.

From the Bottle.
Light golden in colour with a slight haze, very crisp and lively mouth feel.
Subtle spice, honey sweetness with the perfect amount of bitterness on the finish. I want another!

Pours a hazy golden honey color with a huge white head...outstanding lacing and retention.  Aroma has a leafy hoppiness...slightly soapy and delicate...spicy...a bit of hay...somewhat like a saison.  Flavor has a belgian yeasty fruitiness and nice hoppy notes...german accents...spicy and delicate...leafy.  mouthfeel is light and lively with a slightly sweet, grassy finish.  Very nice blonde ale!

Pours golden, with a really really small head and a slight lace. A bit hazy. Aroma is cereals, faint flowers, a bit of resin as well. Good, pretty good! Taste is pretty much a hop-party as far as golden ales are concerned : a bit of everything, really, with a very healthy sourness that feels completely natural. Add in some fruits, grass and oak -- all coming from the malts -- and you have a terrific blonde ale. Those dont really get better than this!
Bouteille 341mL. Couleur doree-pale partiellement voilee. Nez absent, peut-etre trop froide? Longueur moyenne en bouche avec des belles notes de houblon et dherbes. Tres bonne.

Dégustée en fût au Vices & Versa à Montréal. De couleur jaune-dorée et voilée. Nez de pain, moyen de grains de malt pâles, léger de levures fruitées (agrumes, notes dabricots) et de houblon herbeux. aux notes citriques avec des petites notes épicées (poivre très doux). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture très légèrement crémeuse. Légère-moyenne amertume de houblon herbeux aux notes citriques (présente toute la gorgée) accompagné dun moyen goût fruité (agrumes sucrées, notes dabricots) et de traces dépices (poivre) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de grains de céréales avec un moyen-léger goût de pain, des traces de biscuits puis en finale il y a regain damertume de houblon herbeux. Post-goût moyen, léger-moyen amer de houblon herbeux aux notes citriques avec un léger goût fruité (zest dagrumes). (hiver 2006-07)

Sampled at the DC Ratebeer Gathering.  Pours a lightly hazy gold with a very frothy white head.  Nice nose, grassy, hoppy, lemon, herbs, sage, some flowers.  Flavor is sweet, candy sugar, lemon peel, herbs, a little grass.  Medium bodied, herbal finish.

Pours clear rich gold with 2 fingers of dense head and incredible retention and lacing.  Aroma is cheerios, light fruity pilsener malt, grassy hoppiness.  Taste is pilsener-esque with refreshingly clean grain, light sweetness, hints of pepper and honey, barely noticeable ale fruitiness, balanced wood and grass notes from hops.  Body is medium, creamy, average carbonation, full mouthfeel, dry, slightly bitter finish, EXTREMELY drinkable.  Overall, a great representation of the style.  Delicious and fully flavored at 5%abv, this is another big winner from Hopfenstark.

Thanks to noodleuser. Hazy light golden pour with a billowing head. Nose and flavor both held nice notes of lemongrass, orange peel, strawberry, cider, and some good doughy wheat. Clean and crisp palate, quite refreshing. Very nice for the style.
Thanks noodleuser. Hazy straw pour with a monster white head. Lemony dough, orangepeel, lemon candy, and apple/pear cider, sporting a medium body with huge caressing effervescence and a dry finish.

Bottle thanks to noodleuser: pours a slightly hazy golden with a large frothy white head.  Has a sweet light biscuity nose and some light fruity esters.  Starts with good fullness and chewy light malts with a good balance of clove and earthy hops before a drier bittersweet finish.

Heavy perfume and phenolic yeast nose, with pepper and pears. The taste is dry and bitter with lots of pepper, flowers, astringent plant master, grass. Finish is rather harsh, something like chugging perfume or windex.

Bottle shared by Noodleuser.  Pours hazy yellow with a large, frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is grassy, spicy and fresh hops, light malt, earthy yeast, huge fruity esters and spices.  Flavor is fresh, grassy and spicy hops, medium bitterness and fruity esters and a dry finish.  Light body, low warmth, medium carbonation.

750mL thanks to noodleuser. The pour is a clear, light yellow/ blonde with an explosive white head. Massive retention, huge lace. Nose is sugary, sweet, lemon drop, candies, sweet dough, cidery, yellow pear. Oxidized apple slice. Weird. Taste is astringent, weird. Very strange stuff. Not a big fan. Stressed yeast profile. Medicinal lemon abound. Baby powder and mealy apple. Ick.

Bottle: Poured a hazy bright yellow color ale with a huge pure white foamy head with good retention and some nice lacing. Aroma of clean cereal with bready yeast and some floral notes with slight citrus notes. Taste is refreshing while being quite complex with nice mix of clean cereal with nice floral undertones and some light tart and citrus notes with a yeast strain that is bready and funky at the same time. Body is full with limited filtration and good carbonation. Probably one of the best blonde ale I had a chance to taste.

Tap at Sugar Maple.  The beer pours to a murky straw colored body with a thin white head and nice lacing.  The aroma is light pineapple and sweet fruity yeasts and clean grain.  The flavor is sweet fruity and crisp grain.  Nicely balanced hop profile.  The palate is sweet and clean.  This was a nice surprise of a beer and Id have it again.  It was easy drinking.

Bière légèrement dorée, trouble, coiffée dun bon col crème.  Des arômes maltés de pain et un houblonnage floral.  Légèrement amère.  Elle est onctueuse, moyennement effervescente et offre une belle finale aromatique.

On tap at the Sugar Maple in Milwaukee.  Hazy bright golden in color with a small white head and good lacing.  Nice aroma of orange peel, lemon, and Belgian yeast.  The flavor has good dry pale malt and mild grainy notes with big orange and spice with Belgian yeast.  Dry and crisp with lively carbonation.  Really impressive overall.

On tap at Vices/Versa in Montreal.  A hazy blonde beer with lots of earthy honey and herb in the aroma; a strong, simple taste of perfect honey and biscuity/cracker like malts.  Refreshing and bright but with a dank, dusty quality that allows it to feel refined in a way.  Fantastic.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Light gold pour.  Big head.  Aroma of green apple, belgian yeast, slight peppr, lemon, biscuity.  coffee.  Taste   Malty.  Light spices, green apple, grains, lemon rind.  Lighter bodied.  Damn drinkable.

Bouteille 750 ml. 5%. Couleur jaune légèrement voilée, mousse blanche abondante. Arômes de malt, un peu de céréales, houblon et herbes légères. Goût de malt, céréales, houblon, tout en équilibre ET complexe ET qui se boit bien. Une légère amertume en finale. Se boit tellement bien...une douceur, le summum de la blonde.

(Bouteille de 750 ml)  Le liquide a une robe voilée, de couleur jaune paille, pratiquement comme une belle blanche, avec une mousse impeccable et résistante qui laisse derrière son passage de charmantes traces collées au verre.  Le nez de cette bouteille que jimagine très fraîche est pris dans une réelle splendeur de céréales maltées, de blé, de levure, de douces fleurs épicées et de banane trempé dans un léger sirop de miel et de citron.  Le goût est très peu éloigné des arômes avec des saveurs agréablement fleuries et poivrées qui rencontrent des saveurs de blé et dorge malté embellies par des fruits tropicaux subtils qui transpirent la citronnelle et les herbes vertes.  En bouche, le liquide a une structure passablement légère avec une effervescence qui sessouffle considérablement en cours de route et une texture à la limite crémeuse.  La finale se fait sur des notes amères peu intenses mais agréablement florales et épicées.  En résumé, très délicieuse, peut-être même trop.

Draft at Volo in Toronto. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a small diminishing white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus and floral hops. Flavour is certainly hoppy, slightly floral. Along with the hops theres yeast, spices and a nice long bitter finish. Medium bodied. Very likeable.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 pours golden with a decent white head, some retention and lacing. great malt structure, some bready malts, honey, yeast, a certain vinousness. very fruity - subtle pear and apple aromas, some tartness, light to medium body, silky smooth feeling. very good!
Appearance is attractive cloudy yellow with a fizzy white head, aromas and flavors predominantly suggest pear and peppery spice. I went yeah its good or something like that.
21/02/2010. Bottle 750ml. Pours a nice blond/yellow ale. Large head. Aroma is fruity  and floral. Taste is bitter first than fruity. Very refreshing beer.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2011 Draft @ Blind Tiger. Orange golden pour with some white head. Aroma of citrus, pears, light wood and hop notes. Different flavor than the norm for a blond, but follows with citrus grains, malts and slight hop and fruit subtleties.
On tap at Capones. Poured a lighter to medium yellow color with a smaller sized white head. Aromas of citrus, grains, and lighter fruitiness. Tastes of the same citrus (lemons), grains, and grass.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2011 Draft.  Pours an orange blonde body with a white head.  Light citrus, pears, some perfumy hop tones, light wood.  Lagered notes, ice pops, wood, hints of pear juice.  A very flavorful blonde.
There is a zesty slight vanilla aroma. It pours a dark yellow straw color with a small head. The tart wheat flavor is delicious and crisp.

Draught at Capones:  Faint aroma of light malts, light hops, slight citrus, light wheat, and corn.  Poured pale yellow/gold in color with a medium-sized, creamy, dense, white head that lasted throuhgout.  Slightly hazy.  Sparkling.  Excellent lacing.  Light to medium bitter flavor.  Tastes of malts, noble hops, and some grass.  Light to medium body.  Dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Bitter, dry, hop finish.

Bottle from Fred82.  Pours a cloudy, straw yellow.  Aroma is tart with lemon and malt.  Taste is tart with citrus fruit.  Dry mouthfeel with popping flavours of yeast, grain and little subtle flavours that really come out as you savor this beer.  My first Hopfenstark and definitely not my last.

750 ml bottle - thanks after4ever!! pours cloudy yellow with soft white head; lovely nose of soft fruit, pineapple, noble hops and pilsner malt; super dry with slight tartness; flowers, musky lemons, spice, yeast and very rich; love the nose and texture here and while the flavor doesnt quite match the nose, it is extremely tasty with a rich, fruity dryness not in your average golden ale; everything just pops out with this lively brew; wowzers, Hopfenstark is on my radar now!!

Mondial 2009, Montreal.  Yellow-gold and slightly hazy with a nice but short-lived white head.  Aroma of fruit, noble hops and pilsner malt.  And maybe a little honey.  The flavour is slightly sweet, with herbal hops, grainy/grassy malt, and a little citrus and spice.  Incredibly well balanced.  Not a style I usually go out of my way for, but I will for this one.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2009 Tap.  At lAssomption, in their barn-shed, near a haystack.  Many Québec beer geeks seem to wet their pants when it comes to this one...  It is a well deserved satisfaction spasm as this blonde beauty has a hell of a body.  The taste is very grainy and leafy, with subtilititties that leave you wanting more.  Added: Gotta rerate since I now have an addiction.  A tremendous beer in every way, with herbal hop subtilties that I know no word to describe.  Indeed a beer masterpiece.

750. thanks, glouglouburp! pours a cloudy bright yellow with a big, bubbly, woolly head. huge grassy funky nose, sweet, sharp, and delicious. woolly creamy medium body. tons of grass, lemon, white pepper, and funk on the mid palate. nice long spicy finish.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2009 Pint @ Hopfenstark. Clear gold pour with thick white head. Floral and grainy aromas with a bit of yeast (citrus). Great mouth feel saison like in the complexity of flavors yeasty lots of grain a bit of hops with a honey/floral sweetness in aftertaste.
another great golden ale from quebec. Great bready malts, and grains, with some solid hopping. Medium body, and good carb.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2010 750ml bottle from Host. Medium white and thick head. Aroma is fruity and spicy. Hints of saison yeast. Taste is light fruits (apricots maybe). It does feel a bit like a saison.Quite interesting. Have to try it on tap ! Re-rate 100117. On tap at Vices et Versa. Estery nose, really yeasty with some nice crips hops. Taste yeasty, estery and fruity with some hops. Finish is yeasty with some grain. A bit bitter. Aroma 7 t0 8. Overall 15 to 16. Nice beer !

UPDATED: APR 14, 2011 Draft. Clear yellow with a medium frothy white head with good retention and great lacing. Aroma is raw malt, floral hops and a bit of citrus and cloves. Flavor is raw malt, with fruity esters,floral hops, yeast and a bitter finish. Medium to full body.
Glass at the pub. Pale yellow. Grainy and woody scent. Grassy, grainy, slightly worty flavour. Smooth though with a hint of Saaz.

Hopfenstark Ostalgia Blonde 3/14/09 (on tap, Vices et Versa.  Pours gold with a wispy head.  Flavor and aroma are both softly floral, with some detectable sweetness.  Finish is balanced.  Not particularly interesting.

Pours a nice blonde with a great haze and a slight white head. Very tart nose. Taste is also tart with a clean finish. Feels like its almost a blank slate with room for more flavors, but keeps it simple.
Bottle. Pours great body - extremely hazy orange with small white head. Tart aroma. Mild flavorless in the taste, tart towards the finish. Very sessionable.

Thanks to Glouglouburp for the bottle!  Think Luciernagas complexity and RR Damnations touch. Opaque gold, nice fizzy white head and lacing. Nose is ultra-clean, sweet with light malt and grain yet tart in apple and minor banana. Real minor yeast. Flavor is subtle but absolutely balanced and delicious: sweet honey and bready malt right alongside refreshing hop bitterness, lemon, yeast, and slight dust. Carbonated yet wonderfully smooth and supremely drinkable. Master class here.
bouteille de 750ml., blonde trouble avec une mousse qui disparait très vite, nez aigre, bouche qui goûte le grain, finale aigre, pas ma meilleure

Aroma:hopy aroma,citrus,soap...
Apperance:Ligh hazy gold,good white head...
Flavor:dry,strong citrus hops flavor,light sour flavor...

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2008 Thanks to Gregclow for this.  Cheers Greg. Pours a cloudy yellow with a proud white head. Aroma: Lovely wheaty citrusy aroma, some peppery notes too. Flavour: Lovely sour, fruity yet somehow creamy flavour with a short fruity finish. Very enjoyable.

Cloudy yellow poor with a frothy off-white head... good lacing as well..  Aromas of wheat, citrus, fresh yeast, lemon and orange zest, spruce beer.  Medium body, creamy/velvetty nouthfeel.  Very herbal, zesty, citrus flavors.  Well balanced, high quality brew.

Bouteille de 750 ml - Dégusté avec french tickler - Une biere de couleur blonde brumeuse avec un bon collet non-collant. Odeur surette, sucre, épices, pomettes. Gout salé, noix, ammandes, un peu de blé.

Verre de 20 oz, d’un fût au Pub Brouhaha. Arômes de céréales et de houblon européen. Robe dorée, légèrement voilée, légère mousse. Très veloutée en bouche, des céréales croustillantes et une touche de miel mènent à une finale moyennement amère de houblon floral. Très désaltérant.

Bottle, sampled @ Volo(Ralph is the agent for this brewery, kudos on this!)

 Spicy hops nose with some decent malt, hazy yellow, pours a big, though short lived white head, Taste is lemon, malt, a hint of yeast. Crisp, clean, light bodied, easily drinkable, refreshing too. Great example!

Sampled at 08 vt beerfest. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, yeast and fruitness. Flavor is lemon citrus, floral and earthy hops light fruit and a touch of spices. Light to medium body with a bitter finish

[1271-20080410] bottle. Burnt hay grains aroma has a bit of alcoholic yeast and later quite a boozy sweat characteristic. Hazy, light yellow orange body with a quick white creamy head. Super yeasty hops with sweet hay finish thats slightly funky. Medium body. Interesting but strange funky sweat notes.
(c/o GregClow, w/ blankboy, HogTownHarry, jerc, tupalev)
Tap at VBF, minimal white head, hazy gold color, citrus nose. A nice malt sweetness with citrus, hay taste. Another great session ale for the summer.

Lemon citrus, floral and woody hop character greets the nose with sweet underlying malt base.  Very hazy yellow-blonde body is topped by a shy but lasting white head - almost looks a bit like a witbier as it is somewhat viscous.  Flavour reveals a lightly musty, honey-sweet malt character with tart wheat notable, plenty of lemon citrus, woody, earthy, haylike and floral notes from the hops but although the moderate bitterness overtakes the malt sweetness and lingers, it is never overwhelming.  Somewhat spicy in the aftertaste.  Light-medium body with lightly prickly carbonation that awakens the taste buds.  Quite the revelation!  If this were my local I’d be thrilled to be quaffing this all summer long.  Shaker glass.  Just above fridge temperature.  Bottle (bottle conditioned) purchased at the brewery in mid-June.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry, tupalev, jerc & mabel -- from the brewery via GregClow. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a small diminishing white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus and floral hops. Flavour: First thing I notice is the amount of hops, which is a pleasant surprise, especially for a Blond Ale from Quebec. Along with the hops theres yeast, spices and a nice long bitter finish. Medium bodied. A Blond Ale that is hoppier then most beers in Canada, well done indeed!

Bottle at the no Greg tasting, courtesy of, of course, Greg, shared with Hogtown Harry, Blankboy, Jerc, and Mabel.  Nice yeasty aroma, some lemon as well  Nice medium yellow, bubbly white head.  Good taste - surprisingly hoppy, yet yeasty as well with more lemon.  Very flavourful.    A golden ale/blonde is not going to get much more flavourful than this, well done.

2008-04-10. Hazy pale pastel yellow body with a small white head (3+). Interesting aroma, yeast notes, interesting citrus, floral hoppy notes. (7+) Pleasant hoppy notes throughout the flavour, floral, pleasant bitterness, light grassy notes. (7+) Slightly fuller than average palate. Pretty solid. Bottle courtesy of GregClow

Re: Lord of the Rings:"You know, the other elf... the guy who dies..""Jim?"

Bottle (500ml).  No ClowGrs tasting, shared with blankboy, jerc, mabel and tupalev.  Very cloudy light gold, smallish frothy diminishing white head.  Slightly sour aroma, plenty of sharp yeast and moderate spice - hint of lemon and dry grass.  Taste - incredible surprise, heavy, thick fresh grassy bitterness, quite acidic, the malts way in the background here - man this is hoppy.  Thick, still, acidic mouthfeel, long tart grassy-grapefruit pith bitter finish.  Damn nice.  Well done, Fred!!
On tap @ Vices et Versa, Montreal. Herbal, fruity & slightly floral aroma. Medium blonde golden color. citrusy, mildly fruity, nice mouthfeel. decent

500 mL, hand-labelled bottle from the brewery via Lubiere (merci!), served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass.
App.:  Medium golden, clear (but large flecks of yeast in the bottle...), fairly decent white meringue.
  
Aroma:  A nice blend of fruitiness, cereals and hops; cherries, berries, peaches, peppery, light treacle, a very hard to describe green smell, melons, a touch of floral honey, non-descript spices.
  
Palate:  Medium body and kinda soft carbonation that gives a soft overall impression.
  
Flav.:  Peppery-spicy-lemony-fruity; some cereals, a bit off-dry, solid bitterness; leaves a bit of alcohol behind.  Reminds me of a Saison quite a bit.

Interesting stuff.  Certainly has a lot going on for such a seemingly innocent golden ale.

Bottle from the brewery. Pours a light golden colour with a faint haziness and a good sized white head. Aroma is quite yeasty, with some herbal notes and a bit of apple. Body is highly carbonated at first, but calms down as it warms. Flavour is sharp and fresh, with notes of pepper, apple skin, yeast, juniper, and bitter herbs. A very unique beer with a lot more character than a typical golden ale.

Tap at Spuyten Duyvil: Cloudy light golden pour with a creamy white head. Nicely aromatic. Has lots of apple pie, mild butterscotch. Very inviting. Fluffy light body with a rich fruitiness of crisp, fresh apple, mild cherry skin and a mild grassy hop bitterness. A very tasty and drinkable Golden Ale.

Tap at Spuyten Duyvil.  Pale blonde beer, slightly hazy with a thick creamy head. Aroma is very wheaty and spicy.  Softly fruity with a bit of light chewy character.  Lightly melony and a bit minty as well.  Juicy and peachy with lots of honeyish character.  Lemon and a bit of soft bubble gum and bread dough.  Nice, juicy fruity brew.

Tap at Spuyten. This has a superior bready aroma, absolutely fresh, fermenting dough, like walking right into a bakery. I love that in a beer. More dough in the flavor is complemented by some clementine, yeast, mint. Very tasty.

Sputyen.  Pours a hazy blond with a nice creamy rocky white head and nice lace.   Aroma has some DMS and corn in there - doughy, ligth crackery pale malts, som real biscuitiness as well- english malts, and a bit flowery with some citrus notes.  Crackery, chalky, almost dusty flavor with some more DMS, light corniness, straw and grassy with some floral hoppiness in the back of the throat.  Meh- it was Ok.

on tap at Spuyten Duyvil.  Lightly hazy blonde in color.  Aroma is light to moderately hoppy with spice, earth, and floral touches.  Taste is light spicy and earthy hops with fresh bready pale malt.  Body is medium and lightly sweet, touches of floral hops and a light bitterness in the finish.  very clean, I enjoyed this one the most out of the 3 beers they had on tap.

Draft at Spuyten.  Light yellow color, like the inside of a lime.  Aroma is floral hops, spice, and mint.  Flavor is mildly sweet, floral, with spice in the finish.  Some lemony citrus flavors showed through later on.  This is like a better version of domestic white ales.
Draft at Spuyten. Great looking beer with a thick, white head. Flavor is peppery, minty and spearmint. Dry, sweet and full of flavor. I doubt there is a better beer in thus style out there.

Sampled on tap at the Saint-Bock. Pours a cloudy golden color with a thin white head. Good aroma and flavor of honey, malt and grassy hops with a bitter finish. The body is light and the carbonation is gentle. Very good, well-done and well-balanced, kudos to this young, promising brewery.

Sampled draught at the Mondial, Montreal (May 2007).  Opaque yellow-gold with just a touch of head retained....pleasant malty nose, honey-vanilla notes with very little hops, but so fresh and forward with the malts that Im not caring....ah, but then on tasting it, BLAM the rough, earthy-grassy bitterness overwhelms the senses, toasty and a bit smoky even, carrying all the way through to the finish with just enough underlying pale malts to hold it together....citric and rather hard finish but quite refreshing, grapefruit and lime pucker the mouth but leave a smile on the lips....

Draught. Murky whitish-yellow body with a creamy white head. The aroma is bready with fruit notes of apple, apricot, and peach. Nice and crisp biscuity flavour with notable citrus hop bitterness. Finishes slightly thin but overall its quite solid and refreshing. 


Sampled at Mondial on June 1, 2007.

On tap at Mondial 07

Light hazy citric ale with smallish creamy top.

Fresh citric hoppy nose with grainy accents.

Light bodied, with gentle medium bitter tone. Light grainy touches, with raw bitter green finish. Its better than description might suggest. Works well, created pleasant brew.

On tap at Mondial de la Bière (Montréal). Hazy blond body with a good white foamy head. Average malty/hoppy aroma with light bready and yeasty notes. Taste is rather thin. It ends with a decent bittersweet finish.

cloudy yellow/peach and unfiltere. Good yeast and hop and fresh. Grapefruit and some yeast in aroma. Medium plus creamy mouthfeel.Nice hopping. This is a big time upcoming brewery based on 6 months real time brewpub displayed here.

A light hazy golden ale with a thick creamy white head. A biscuity malt aroma with peppery hops notes. In mouth, a crisp sweetish malt, light lactic notes, herbal hops, and light berry notes.  Medium bodied. On tap at Vices versa, Jan. 2007.

Sample, Vices et Versa, savoured on January 20 2007; eye: straw, clear, no effervescence, lacing; nose: aggressive malt, bread, light hops; mouth: aggressive malt, finale in malt with a hint of bitterness and bread, average carbonation, slightly grainy and a bit thin texture, average astringency, medium body; overall: correct

FRANÇAIS 

Échantillon, Vices et Versa, savourée le 20 janvier 2007; oeil : paille, claire, pas deffervescence, dentelle; nez : malt agressant, pain, léger houblon; bouche : malt un peu agressant, finale en malt avec une pointe damertume et de pain, carbonatation moyenne, texture légèrement granuleuse et un peu mince, astringence moyenne, corps moyen; en résumé : correct
Bu à Vices et Versa en fut (10 oz). Jaune blanche come la crème patissière, petit collet. Arome de blé légèrement épicé et dherbe fraiche. Goût sec de blé, un peu dherbe et de grain sucré.

On-tap at Vices & Versa.
Peachy golden ale that was slightly opaque with a decent head.

Excellent crisp noble hop aroma, freshly crushed grain, some hay, kind of reminded me of the bottled Kellerbiers MartinT brought back from Germany.  Nothing super fancy here, just well made.

Perfectly balanced bubbly carbonation, chewy, honest base malt and green, grassy hops.  For a first try, they really nailed it!  This Beer is going to be amazing during the summer months.

On tap at Vices&Versa, slight hazy honey gold hue, with a white head, leaving laces, yeasty, raw pale malt, with a wet cereals note, hint of orange fruitiness, with a mild floral hops citrusy, in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a crisp, zesty citrusy flowery hops character, with some pale malts graininess, hint of vanilla spiciness,touch of leafiness, flirting with a subtle fruity raspberry acidic yeastiness, leading towards a hops bittering finish.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2007 Now hear about this lovely and rocking little novelty. It is a cloudy golden ale topped by an honest sheet of white foam. Appealing and growing on you nose takes one aback by its rather estery fruity notions that march beside the skillful extraction which allows such clean and pure graininess, crunchy fresh cereals from the most humble and yet apt basic pale malts. Natural  and engaging carbonation and its sibling yeastiness impart an invigorating texture which deploys its charms down to the bottom of the throat. Crisp noble hops appear more and more vigorous by the sip, grassy, leafy, yet more into bittering and balancing purposes than aromas. Now thats a pleasant and unexpected surprise. An absolutely gorgeous little session ale, basically what could be made into a futuristic Saison if we ever come back to the hardcore farming. This is feeding by its mere texture, light in alcohol, hugely drinkable and charmingly flavorful, screaming its love for the ingredients it originated from while letting the drinker know of the masterful hands which are behind their integration.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2009 Complete re-write for the new bottled version, that is surprisingly/inexplicably superior and quite different from the already excellent tap version
In short: 
How: Bottle 750ml.  Consumed fresh.  MUST BE consumed fresh.
The look: Cloudy banana yellow body topped by a persistent medium white head
In long: Nose of fresh cereals and freshly cut grass.  Theres a ton of cereals in this baby, oh man, how were they able to fit so much cereals in a beer that end-up feeling so soft?  Big fresh hay character.  Fruity flavours of lemon, bananas, pineapples, a little green apples touch.  A lot of grassy hops with a character that differs from the usual Saaz-ish dry grassiness.  This is like soft freshly cut grass, hard to describe.  Overall sensation of meringue.  Body is as full as I can hope for the this type of beer and the carbonation is appropriately average.  Finish is dry and rather tart that makes it exceptionally refreshing.  Fantastic brew, and to think that this is Hopfenstark entry-level blonde beer.  If all entry-level products were that good, the Ford Focus would not exist.

En fût. Verre de 12 oz dégusté au Saint-Bock (Montréal, QC). Arôme: Odeur dagrumes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrumes avec une pointe dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence dagrumes en arrière goût. (Rating #841)
Robe blonde voilée surmontée dune mousse blanche mince qui sestompe. Arômes minces de houblon aromatique. Saveurs de houblon aromatique et de malt.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2011 Any first impressions?
-A frothy head dissipates into the hazy pale straw.
-Well-developed cereals proudly reach the nostrils as subdued hoppiness do not announce the potency of their presence in the flavor profile.
-Soaring noble, herbal hops carry into a leafy bitterness, gravitating around the purported chewy cereals.
-The ample yet drinkable maltiness and soft, big-bubbled effervescence emulates Franconian/Bavarian unfiltered lagers.

What if you dig deeper?
-Honeyed bananas discreetly approach the spicy, herbal hoppiness.
-I am reminded of Drei Kronen Schesslitzs Lagerbier. Very impressive!!
-Immensely drinkable yet never frail, this competently-brewed German countryside classic (as an ale, in this case) cannot fail to please. An amazing beginning for this new microbrewer. THIS is a golden ale!

On tap at Vices et Versa and at the brewery, plus many times from the bottle.
